summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 between FBI agents and a federal prosecutor coordinating logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to review evidence in her criminal case. It details security procedures, schedules, and the movement of Maxwell and evidence at the federal courthouse in New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the defendant in the criminal case and is to be escorted by US Marshals from custody to the proffer room at 500 Pearl Street for her defense team's evidence review.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI agent from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking desk is coordinating the evidence review logistics, scheduling agents, and communicating security procedures.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: An AUSA from the Southern District of New York is expressing gratitude, providing contact information, and noting that other prosecutors on the case may stop by during the evidence review.

connections.description: The FBI agent is involved in the logistical coordination for Maxwell's defense evidence review, which is part of the ongoing criminal investigation and prosecution against her.
The AUSA is part of the prosecution team for the criminal case against Maxwell and is involved in facilitating the defense's evidence review.

events.title: Defense Evidence Review - Day 1
events.description: Scheduled start of a multi-day review of highly confidential evidence by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team at 500 Pearl Street, New York.

events.title: Defense Evidence Review - Day 2
events.description: Continuation of the defense team's review of evidence in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Defense Evidence Review - Day 3
events.description: Continuation of the defense team's review of evidence in the Maxwell case.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York (Federal courthouse and US Attorney's office)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York US Attorney's Office)
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, implied as Maxwell's place of custody)
keyFacts: The email chain details strict security protocols for Ghislaine Maxwell's movement: she is to be escorted by two personnel, cuffed during transit, but can be uncuffed in the proffer room.
The evidence under review includes highly confidential images from CDs and from Jeffrey Epstein's devices that the defense had not previously seen.
The review was scheduled for April 13-15, 2021, from 9:30 AM to 4:30 PM, with a requirement for FBI agents to arrive by 8 AM due to early evidence delivery.
The correspondence shows coordination between the FBI, US Marshals, US Attorney's Office, and Pre-trial Services for a pre-trial evidence review in a high-profile case.
